intro: Teruncius arvensis, commonly known as the field teruncius, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers that appear in umbel-like clusters. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as fields and roadsides. Its leaves are pinnately divided, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Teruncius arvensis is often found in temperate regions and is relatively easy to cultivate in suitable conditions.
